comparison.title: Comparing Traditional Facelift & Minimally Invasive Facelift

definition.title: What is a Facelift?
definition.content: A facelift, also known as a rhytidectomy, is a surgical procedure that improves visible signs of aging in the face and neck. It tightens and removes sagging skin, repositions underlying tissues, and smooths out wrinkles and lines, resulting in a more youthful and rejuvenated appearance.

symptoms.title: Candidates for Facelift
listItems: Signs of aging in the face and neck

treatment.title: Treatment Options
treatment.content: There are several facelift techniques to choose from, ranging from traditional surgical procedures to minimally invasive or non-surgical methods. The best approach depends on the patient's preferences, desired results, and the extent of the signs of aging.

prevention.title: Maintaining Results
listItems: Protecting your skin from the sun
